DataElement.preferredDefinition: an assessment response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable regarding a patient's pregnancy.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: the state of being pregnant; the period from conception to birth when a woman carries a developing fetus in her uterus.

Concepts.definition: The state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), after union of an ovum and spermatozoon, during the period from conception to birth.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the patient's ability to conceive or nurse offspring and/or their current reproductive status.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the patient pregnant or nu
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient pregnant or nursing

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient pregnant or breastfeeding

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Females must not be breastfeeding. Please check N/A for male patients.

ReferenceDocuments.name: AECC Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient pregnant (positive pregnancy test) or nursing? (N/A only if patient is male)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Pregnancy, nursing, or unwilling to take adequate birth control during therapy.  If not a woman of childbearing potential or male (check N/A).

ReferenceDocuments.name: ACRIN 6690
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the participant pregnant?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient pregnant or breastfeeding within 30 days of discontinuation of therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient or sexual partner become pregnant during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Pregnancy or nursing or unwilling to take adequate birth control during therapy. If not a woman of childbearing potential, please check N/A.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient currently breastfeeding

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pregnant or breastfeeding, or expecting to conceive or father children within the projected duration of the trial, starting with the screening visit through 120 days after the last dose of MK-3475 administration. If not a woman of childbearing potential, please check N/A

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pregnant or breastfeeding, or expecting to conceive or father children within the projected duration of the trial, starting with the pre-screening or screening visit through 120 days after the last dose of trial treatment.  If not a woman of childbearing potential, please check N/A.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: If female, is participant pregnant or breast-feeding?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient is pregnant or breast-feeding. If not a woman with reproductive potential or a male, please check N/A.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient a nursing woman?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient a pregnant or nursing female?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient or sexual partner become pregnant during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient a pregnant woman?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CE7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient pregnant or nursing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: OPEN Checklist
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are you currently pregnant?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient a pregnant female?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient pregnant or breastfeeding, or expecting to conceive children within the projected duration of the study, starting with the screening visit through 7 months after the last dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient pregnant, nursing, or expecting to conceive or father children?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient a breast feeding or lactating female

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 14

ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient is breastfeeding, do they agree to discontinue breastfeeding while on study?
